title: Driving school manager gets prison time for passing unqualified drivers in State Police license fraud scheme
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Scott Camara sentenced to one month in prison for role in Massachusetts State Police CDL license fraud scheme.
Camara pleaded guilty to perjury and conspiracy, admitted to passing unqualified CDL applicants without required skills tests.
Federal prosecutors sought 10 months imprisonment; Camara's attorney requested probation citing his limited role and personal implications.

title: Red Sox reportedly calling up pitching prospect for MLB debut, sending Dustin May to IL
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Connelly Early, a 23-year-old left-handed pitcher, will make his MLB debut for the Red Sox against the Athletics.
Boston Red Sox pitcher Dustin May is heading to the Injured List after struggling with a 5.40 ERA in six appearances.
Early has a 10-3 record with a 2.60 ERA and 132 strikeouts in 100.1 innings in the minor leagues this year.

title: Mass. teen facing assault with dangerous weapon charges in road rage incident near high school
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: A 19-year-old from Dedham faces assault charges after a road rage incident near Dedham High School.
Dedham police responded to a fight report on Whiting Avenue at 3:38 p.m. Monday, unrelated to the school.
The 19-year-old suspect is charged with assault and battery with a dangerous weapon and malicious vehicle damage.

title: Report: Jabrill Peppers signs with the Steelers
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Jabrill Peppers signs with Pittsburgh Steelers after being released by the New England Patriots.
Peppers, a former Patriots captain, played six games last season, dealing with injuries and legal issues.
Peppers will return to Gillette Stadium with the Steelers on September 21 for a game against the Patriots.

title: Live results: 2025 Boston mayoral preliminary election
author: John Waller
bullets: Boston's 2025 mayoral preliminary election includes candidates Michelle Wu, Josh Kraft, Robert Cappucci, and Domingos DaRosa.
The preliminary election will narrow the field of mayoral candidates from four to two.
Mayor Michelle Wu enters the election with a significant 50-point lead over challenger Josh Kraft.

title: Survey says Mass. is happy, but not TOO happy. How about you?
author: Peter Chianca
bullets: Massachusetts ranked as the ninth happiest state in the U.S. according to a WalletHub survey.
Massachusetts excels in 'Work Environment' and 'Emotional & Physical Well-Being', ranking sixth and eighth respectively.
Vermont ranked 29th for happiness, with high adult depression despite leading in 'Adequate-Sleep Rate'.

title: After 2024 chaos, Boston’s polling places are stocked with extra ballots
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Boston's election department has been under state control following issues with ballot shortages in the 2024 election.
Secretary of State William Galvin ordered an overhaul, including adding extra ballots and Poll Pads at all 275 polling locations.
The election department improved its communication system, addressing past issues with overwhelmed phone lines and coordination failures.

title: Man charged in unprovoked attack of woman walking in the South End
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Jose Edgardo Miranda-Martinez, 62, charged with assault in unprovoked attack on a woman in Boston's South End.
The incident occurred at 190 W. Canton St.; the victim was punched three to four times and received medical evaluation.
Miranda-Martinez claimed the attack was a response to a 'game' against him; he was charged with disorderly conduct.

title: Report: Four of Bill Belichick’s trademark applications have been denied
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Bill Belichick's trademark applications for four phrases were denied by the USPTO due to similarity with Patriots' trademarks.
The denied trademarks include variations of 'Do Your Job', 'Ignore the Noise', and 'No Days Off' indicating potential consumer confusion.
TCE Rights Management, managed by Belichick's girlfriend, may appeal the ruling within three months; other phrases had no conflicts.

title: Spike Lee explained why he has ‘respect for the Red Sox’ despite being constantly trolled by fans
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Spike Lee, a Yankees fan with a home in Massachusetts, spoke about his respect for the Red Sox.
Lee was asked to throw the first pitch at Fenway Park despite wearing a Yankees jersey.
Red Sox fans regularly troll Lee by leaving golf balls with anti-Yankees messages on his property.
